result.execSummary:
The defendant Andria K Madison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement
With Jury Instructions attached.
Huber Law Notification Slip.

Case called at 2:41 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Andria K Madison in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Theft, Movable Property, contrary to 943.20(1)(a)

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to serve 25 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; the first 5 days of sentence to be served and the remaining 20 days are to be used at discretion of the Agent. 5 days to commence 7/14/14 at 7:00 pm 
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with Michael Geneman, Michael Brown, Sara Hazwbrouck (Geneman)
--No contact with Rosemary Schmied unless both she and agent agree
--To pay $3400 restitution. payable to Cash into Gold, Madison WI 
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

Days credit for time already served: 1 day - can be applied to condition time
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation; Court indicates that Defendant can ask for early termination after 18 months of probation is served ONLY if restitution has been completely satisfied.
Recess: 3:13 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 11:30am.  Clerk - CRHI. (Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Br. 4)
Defendant Andria K Madison in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form submitted.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding and intent.  Court accepts the waiver.
Court finds probable cause that the Def. committed a felony and binds the Def. over for arraignment and trial.

ARRAIGNMENT:
Information filed.  Service of Information admitted; reading waived.  Maximum penalties recited.  
Not guilty plea entered as to all counts.  
Court continues bond.  
Recess 11:35am.

Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:35 pm.  

Defendant Andria K Madison in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant does qualify for SPD representation.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct. 

The Court finds Probable Cause to support Counts #1 and #2 in the Criminal Complaint.

Court requires $10,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Rosemary Schmied, Michael Geneman, or Michael Brown 
-No presence at Rosemary Schmied's residence or Pawn Shops
-Return one time to Rosemary Schmied's residence with law enforcement to collect personal belongings.
-Provide new address to the C.O.C.'s office within 48 hours of Ms. Madison learning of said address.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties. 

Recess: 1:44 pm.
